info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL, SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA, NORTHEASTERN SANTA FE AND SOUTHWESTERN MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cowles, or 20 miles northeast of Santa Fe, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tererro, Cowles, Tierra Monte, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, Gascon, South Carmen, Rociada, Monte Aplanado, and the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Fire. This includes the following highways... State Road 63 between Mile Markers 14 and 25. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 8 and 16. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
